name: Quirky room in small warehouse
summary: 5 mins walk from Seven Sisters tube, north London. Alternative, creative living in artist community area. The big living area looks out west to the setting sun, the skylight in the room shows the stars. Near 2 parks & the river Lea's boat life.
description: 5 mins walk from Seven Sisters tube, north London. Alternative, creative living in artist community area. The big living area looks out west to the setting sun, the skylight in the room shows the stars. Near 2 parks & the river Lea's boat life.
host_about: Hello, I am a filmmaker and photographer who's lived in London most of her life and I am now living in Nairobi. I travel quite a lot for work, so I have an empty, lush, one bedroom apartment a lot of the time. When I travel, I like to stay with local people and avoid hotels at all costs, so I like to open up that possibility to people coming to Nairobi and wanting to stay somewhere different and experience the city from another point of view. I live in a one bedroom in a block of flats with a mixed community of young people, families, Indian, Kenyan, Middle Eastern... There is a kindergarten downstairs, and the best view in town. If you fancy some city living, this is the place for you.
street: Markfield Road, London, England N15 4QF, United Kingdom

neighborhood_overview: The Clayton neighborhood is one of the most diverse, inclusive, and connected communities in the Denver area. Neighborhood activities included free soccer camps and Friday cookouts at City of Nairobi Park. Local businesses range from high-end bistros to family-owned BBQ joints, authentic Mexican, etc. and it's just over a mile to RiNo District, where the best live jazz (at Nocturne), the best coffee joints, bars, breweries and artisan shops are exploding, just a few blocks north of Coors Field, one of the coolest baseball parks in the country.  Brand new light rail stop is a mile from the house, which takes you straight to the gorgeous newly renovated Union Station and all the way out to the airport.
transit: •Brand new light rail stop is less than a mile from the house.  •38 Bus route is two blocks away, 43 is five blocks.  •Platte River bike trail and bike lanes into the city are easy to access. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on S.3rd & Bedford Avenue - which is the beginning of the popular Bedford Avenue Strip. It's in the quieter end of it so you will enjoy the benefits of this busy neighborhood in a quiet space.  You will be half a block away from great restaurants, bars, shops, food markets, etc.
notes: - We live on the 5TH FLOOR of a walk-up. (NO ELEVATOR) Please make sure you are aware of this before you book!!  - If I or my apartment manager is not home when you arrive, he/she will give you instructions to pick up the keys. - Our bathroom is small as shown in the photo, but is always perfectly clean! :) However, we do not have a cleaning person everyday, so I ask that guests be courteous of the other guests in the apartment and clean up after themselves. I always want the entire space to be comfortable for everyone and will always be sure to do everything I can to make that happen! I only ask that we all help each other stay happy and comfortable in a clean space!
transit: Transportation:  The apartment is 7 minutes away from the L train on the Bedford Avenue Stop, one stop to Manhattan and 5 minutes from Union Square. The L train will take you from the East side to the West side connecting you to all of the major subway lines in NYC.  It is also located 7 minutes away in the opposite direction from the J/M/Z lines. These lines will take to the center of the Lower East Side, Chinatown, City Hall, Wall Street, and Fulton Street which is a 7 minute walk from the South Street Seaport. The M train will take you directly into Midtown. Subway map: (URL HIDDEN)  L train is the gray line  J/M/Z trains are the brown line  PARKING: There is free street parking on my street and the streets around the building, but there are alternate side parking rules that you have to be aware of and follow to avoid getting parking tickets.
access: Guests have access to all the common areas (living room/kitchen, etc.) Everyone MUST be considerate of each other. Please clean up after yourselves in all common areas especially the bathroom!!  We cannot be available to clean the bathroom everyday, and depend on the guests to clean up after themselves.  AMENITIES:  - Washing machine and Dryer in the apartment (this is a luxury one does not find in many NYC apartments! or hotels!)  - Full Kitchen  - Coffee and Tea - you can enjoy great meals all over the neighborhood or buy cool stuff at the local supermarkets to prepare at the apartment! :) - Free Wifi Web Access - Hair Dryer - Iron & Ironing Board  - Fresh Towels / Bed Linens  - Air Conditioner - 1 set of keys per 2 people (come and go as you please)
interaction: When I am not in the apartment myself, I spend my time in Nairobi, Kenya with my husband. In my absence, there is always an apartment manager in the 3rd bedroom to help with any questions you may have.  I am also always available via email and respond very quickly.
house_rules: 2 people max. PER BEDROOM - Must provide ID (Passport/License) for security purposes. No events or parties allowed. Packages CANNOT be ordered or delivered to my address.  Please, no pets (I'm allergic!)  No Smoking (I'm allergic to that, too!) No Drugs or Hard Alcohol however, we can all enjoy a nice wine! :o) Be respectful of neighbors and the space  Keep noise down after hours  Clean up after yourself

name: Welcome to your Hollywood Bungalow!
summary: This private tropical retreat is in the heart of everything yet a world away.  Located in a safe, quiet West Hollywood neighborhood; walk to restaurants, shops and grocery stores.  Play tennis at Plummer Park or hike directly to Runyan Canyon!
space: If your looking for a private relaxed setting and don't want to be in an apartment building, our private Bungalow is perfect for you.   The space is shared with the main house, a 1920s Craftsman and sits on 1/6 acre in the middle of Hollywood! Nestled among four massive 70 year old avocado trees, the quiet setting offers a more tranquil place to stay whilst visiting the Hollywood/Los Angeles area.  Situated in a safe walkable West Hollywood neighbourhood, we're a world away from the jungle of LA and the craziness of Hollywood yet minutes to everything.   It's the perfect getaway for one or two or three people, a family of 3 or 4 or two couples.   A one year old queen size Sealy Posturepedic bed combined with the reclining sofa bed sleeps four comfortably.  A black-out curtain separates the bedroom from the living area. It's so quiet here, you would never know you you're in the heart of Hollywood.   Awake to sunshine and chirping birds and a perfect place to start your meditation or tai

neighborhood_overview: Our Bungalow couldn't be in a better location- in the heart of Hollywood yet steps away from everything- and so quiet.  We're in, Little Russia, a family neighborhood with hipsters and seniors. Babushka's is right up the street!   This neighborhood is walkable.  Its very rare in LA to be able to walk to stores/grocery/ restaurants/nightlife but here you have that option.  People around here actually walk on the sidewalk and are not tourist attractions!! EVERY MONDAY MORNING - AN INCREDIBLE FARMERS MARKET at PLUMMERS PARK FROM 9AM TO 2PM.  Fresh fruit, veggies, fish, flowers, etc. Park your car and walk to the Hollywood Bowl, Hollywood or Sunset Blvd or shopping on Melrose Ave or Santa Monica Blvd.  Your choice - thats the great part!
notes: The house is secured with an alarm system and the tropical gardens are attended to every Thursday morning.
transit: Walk to the Red Line METRO and city buses are aplenty especially the CityLine - yes for 25 cents it will take you throughout West Hollywood all the way down to Robertson Blvd!
access: INSIDE Guests have access to the fully equipped kitchen including full size refrigerator, over, dishwasher, microwave, toaster oven, blender, garbage disposal and coffee maker.  Cookware, silverware and all kinds of glasses are stocked. There's also a clothes washer available but no dryer, I'm afraid.  However, we have a clothes line outside for that SoCal sun dry freshness. The sofa coverts to a full size bed that sleeps two.  The sofa bed bedding is all in the coat closet with extra pillows in the master closet. A Samsung 42in LED high def TV with cable and HBO.  A DVD player and Wi-Fi all included.  Enjoy the outside inside with 2 skylights!  And there's a ceiling fan in every room. Iron and Ironing board available in the master bed closet for your convenience. OUTSIDE Enjoy the outdoors, the tropical gardens or shady gazebo.  Or just lounge in the Adirondack chairs or chill under the shady avocado trees. Cook up some BBQ, steaks or whatever at the gourmet outdoor kitchen - complete
interaction: I've been in Los Angeles since 1996 and know the area well.  I would be happy to point out all the great LA/Hollywood sites.    I love foreign guests!  Having lived internationally, I've been in your shoes!  Let me show you some Southern California hospitality and make you feel at home.    I live on the property and can assist anytime. I'm an avid hiker and used to be an eco tour guide, giving hikes throughout Southern California.  From Griffith Park and Runyan Canyon to Deep Creek and Solstice Canyon, I am available for a nominal fee to take you or your group on any of the hikes mentioned or any trail in Southern California.  Just ask! Also, se hable español aqui!
house_rules: The Bungalow sits in a quiet neighborhood and we ask that you keep the noise to a minimum and respect our neighbours. No smoking in the Bungalow please.
host_about:
Hello, I'm a well traveled, clean, conscientious individual originally from Pennsylvania, now living in Los Angeles.  I am very relaxed and my surroundings reflect that.  I'm a writer/producer.  

I've lived all over America/world - Boston, Houston, San Francisco, Philadelphia, New York City, Indianapolis, Nassau, Bahamas, Paris, France and London, England.   I have also traveled all over too -  from Tokyo, Seoul & Nairobi to Cairo, Bankcok & Rio.  I love to trade travel stories with my guests.  

But since 1996,  I have found my home in Los Angeles.  From mountains to deserts to beaches, LA is an incredible place to live.   I'm happy to share this great space with others and eager to make your stay amazing.

Peace

host_about: I am Augustin. My friends also call me "Gusty". As a "citizen of the world",  I am lucky to have grown and evolved through many cultures. I was born and raised in Yaoundé in the beautiful country of Cameroon.  At age 20, I moved to Colorado to attend the U.S Air Force Academy where I studied electrical engineering and trained and competed in collegiate boxing. I went on the graduate school and completed a master’s degree in electrical engineering with an emphasis in radar and electromagnetic wave propagation. I work as a consultant for fiber distributed antennas systems for better speed and data rates inside high-capacity building for technologies such as 4G LTE and Wi-Fi. I am also working on several other entrepreneurial ventures that I hope will spread all over the world soon. I love to travel for work or pleasure, meet new people, and experience new foods and cultures. I love to train in Brazilian jiu-jitsu and I bring my kimono everywhere I go.  I also love trail running, high altitude hiking, boxing, Thai boxing, wrestling, mma, and yoga. My favorite places to go include San Francisco, Denver, Yaoundé, Nairobi, and Malawi. I would love to visit Brazil to train BJJ and Iceland to hike an active volcano next. I am a huge James Bond fan. My favorites 007 movie are Octopussy and Die Another Day. I like to catch a Jazz or Reggae show when possible.  I love all kinds of food and I will eat anything, especially lots of spices, fish, vegetables and meats. When I travel I love to feel fully immerse into the local culture. That is why I don’t hotels anymore else absolutely necessary. When I host a guest, I treat them like an old friend who visiting from another town. I want to them be as comfortable as possible and fully enjoy their stay. I tell them about places to see and what restaurants to try. I am fluent in English, French and I am learning Portuguese and Spanish. My life motto is: “Treat all people with respect, live passionately!”

neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood with an "87" walkability score. Local shopping, including a specialty grocery store a few minutes' walk away ((URL HIDDEN) along with access to Miracle Mile (1 mile from front door): Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Peterson Auto Museum, El Rey theater, supermarkets (Ralphs, Smart & Final, Lassen's), drug stores (Walgreens, Rite Aid), post office, restaurants & cafes, etc.
notes: One gated, secure parking space is included with your rental. Access is via remote control, which you keep in your car during your stay.
transit: Drive a short way to the Grove shopping center with cinema and premium shops. Lots of Metro bus service to both Santa Monica, Downtown L.A. and the light rail, plus Lyft and Uber options galore. A bike with a carrier is available if you want to use it, although it would need TLC to be ride-ready. Includes one secured, gated parking spot on the property. There is also street parking, but watch for street cleaning signs.
access: Lockbox allows for 24-hour access and check-in/check-out. Access apartment via keypad lock. Each new guest receives their own unique code, which is deleted upon checkout. During your stay, you are always the only guest with access to the apartment.
interaction: My assistant Colleen (also an avid and enthusiastic Airbnb user!) lives a couple of miles down the road, should questions or needs arise.
house_rules: No smoking inside the apartment or anywhere on the property. No firearms anywhere on the property. No candles, incense, or other burning items in the apartment.  Turn off lights and A/C when not at home.  Before checking out, please tidy up per house policy: turn off A/C; place linens & dishes in respective washers and turn on; make sure door locks behind you; return pedestrian gate key to lockbox.
host_about:
Retired architect with an apartment in L.A. which I renovated, and which we let to nice people on Airbnb. I really tried to bring the Mid-Century building up to modern standards by simplifying the floor plans, making the bathroom bigger, putting in new double-glazed vinyl windows, insulation in the ceiling, modern kitchen & bathroom, and washer/drying, dishwasher, big fridge, microwave vented to outside, and central air and heat instead of the old space heater. It is now very nice. 

I like design in cars, apartments, graphics, etc. I collect the paintings of Maggie Thomas Topping, and have several on display. She is a wonderful painter. Sometimes I just sit and look at the one in the living room. I hung the one in the bedroom up high, because that replicates the vantage point of the artist when she painted it. There is so much in her work. I get an aesthetic response from it. And, I look for that, that emotional buzz like no other feeling. It taps into our creative side. It is unique. It is like the rush you get when you hear a certain piece of music, or see a sunset, or anything that does it just for you. It can be in cars, architecture, etc. Anything that doesn't give that spark isn't work looking at, or listening to...to me anyway.

Right now I am in Africa, where we have a second home. So we put our L.A. apartment up for others to use and enjoy. Our able assistant, Colleen, handles it for us, She does a great job. If you take our place you will meet her when she welcomes you.

I like guests seeing and enjoying our apartment. It is sort of like being an actor and hearing applause, real or imagined. (Helps with the mortgage, too!)

I especially respond to great design in cars. My fave car was my 1950 Studebaker Starlight Coupe, designed by Raymond Loewy, with the wrap-around rear window, and nose-cone front end. I also had a '55 Studebaker Coupe which was way ahead of its time, by the same designer. And I loved owning until a few years ago: a '93 Cadillac Coupe de Ville, bought used, in charcoal color, the last Coupe de Ville made. 

I go to classic car shows in California, and take lots of pictures. 
Biking is more than a hobby. I get into a zone like i did when i experienced the freedome of movement on my bike as a kid, growing up in Long Island. I still get something like a meditative state going on a bike. So, I bike whenever I can. 

On my way to Nairobi recently, I spent a week in London, where I rented a bike from the Fat Tire Company, near Regents Park, a great place for biking. Fat Tire was started by an American living in Paris, and has a branch in Berlin, where I rented their bike also. I believe they operate in Madrid, and I want to rent there, too. Copenhagen was the best place to get around on a bike because they really have really good bike lanes and roads. A huge amount of the residents bike all the time. It was a lot of fun belonging to that culture temporarily.

In Los Angeles and Pasadena, I have been to several Cyclavia events, which are when they close areas of the city to cars. It's just bikes, skates, boards, etc. There is so much enjoyment by so many people, it is really a great day, taking back L.A. from the cars!

In Nairobi, I bike in the Karura Forest, about the only place safe enough, and it is really beautiful and peaceful.

In Los Angeles, I have a bike at my place you can use - at your own risk of course. (God! Lawyers!)

Our place is really handy for biking. You can go to the grocery store, restaurants, The Grove mall & cinemas, Starbucks, and several parks. There is a very nice and reasonably priced genuine French restaurant within biking distance on Pico Blvd near us, called Chic. We go there frequently.

Some days I don't touch the car at all when I am in L.A. Amazing! Imagine that! I hope you will try it if you are into biking. It is such a great way to get exercise, among other things.

house_rules: No parties. No drugs. Clean up after yourself. Basic grown up behavior.
host_about:
I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I work for Apple. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first and second floors. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private) and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that's available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me). We also have a luxury 1 bedroom flat downtown in River North. Plus hope to be adding another River North location very soon. 
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek (obviously, as I work for Apple). I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. 
I am totally new to AirBnB and I have never been a guest — but I have friends and family who are guests (and hosts) and I just decided to do this instead of renting out the garden apartment this year. 
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

name: Newly renovated cute & bright apartment in Tetuan
summary: My place is close to the 1 metro line - Tetuan Metro stop. The 1 is the oldest line in Madrid. It stops within walking distance to many tourist destinations with a quick connection to the airport. Tetuan is one of the most ethnically diverse areas of Madrid. There are a number of bakeries, supermarkets, restaurants, bars and plazas near the apartment.  The apartment itself is light with everything new and in working order. It is a cozy spot perfect for solo travelers, couples or 2-3 friends.
space: The apartment building was built in  1924 and my particular apartment was owned by the same family since then. I purchased the apartment in 2014 and completely renovated the interior to expose the beams, create more open space and restore the patio to its original size.  It is a one bedroom, one bath, open kitchen living room space apartment. In addition to the bathroom in the apartment, there is a old tiny one in the common hallway that is supposed to be shared by me and my neighbor. I would recommend using only in emergencies but it is there if needed.

neighborhood_overview: Tetuan is a wonderful neighborhood. It is very diverse and filled with people from all over the world. Food from Peru, Morocco, Columbia, Paraguay the Dominican Republic and more can be found around the apartment and in the neighborhood. There are also fantastic bakeries and good supermarkets. Latino (south american supermarkets) and traditional Spanish supermarkets are within a 3-5 minute walk. A famous Spanish Paella Restaurant is within walking distance.
notes: I have a deposit on the house because almost everything in the house is new. The renovations were completed in July and the washer and fridge only arrived in January and have barely been used.
transit: The 1 Metro stop Tetuan is the stop for the apartment and is at most 5 minutes away. The one line goes to all of the major spots. It also connects with the other lines to the airport and take less than 40 minutes. Taxis and busses are also easy to find on Bravo Marillo--the main large street.
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment. I request that if they smoke they only smoke outside on the patio. There are gyms along Bravo Marillo and a Kundalini Yoga Center just at the corner of Calle Tablada and Bravo Marillo.
interaction: I am based in Kenya but am always available via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) and I have a co-host that is permanently in Madrid and available.
house_rules: - Smoking on Patio but not inside the apartment - A small number of visitors are permitted but the space is tight and out of respect for the neighbors should be restricted to 6 people max - Most of the guests interactions will be with the property manager but I will always be available via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) as well. I am primarily based in Kenya
host_about:
I love to travel and see the world. I have lived in more than 10 countries and travel all over. I move between Nairobi and Madrid. 

 I work in development--specifically working on improving energy access for small cottage industries, small holder farmers and households. Focus is through renewable and energy efficient products. I also work in sustainable agriculture--integrating permaculture concepts into farming ecosystems that keep the environment resilient and strong while providing increase income streams for the base of the pyramid.

space: You'll enjoy a panoramic view of the city -- from the Loop to Wrigley Field -- that's bright by day and majestic by night, when the city lights glitter below. neighborhood_overview: We're at the edge of Lakeview, right where it gives way to Boys Town (the LGBTQ center of Chicago). That's one block away from Belmont Harbor, five blocks away from Wrigley Field, and a stone's throw away from tons of amazing restaurants and bars. (For the sake of privacy, we placed the pin a couple blocks away from our true location -- we can send the exact address upon inquiry.)
notes: We've got great neighbors, and the building will treat you as a resident.  That means agreeing to a standard background check, even if you're coming from abroad. You just have to fill out a release form, and they take care of the rest. One thing they will not do is accept mail and packages for people who are not on the lease, but there is a mail receiving place around the corner where you can rent a mailbox. I still ask that you contact us first for any non-emergency issues. The management has been great, and we don't want to become a nuisance.
transit: If you want to head downtown, you can easily walk or bike along the lake, and if you're in a hurry you can take one of three buses that stop across the street and take you right to the Loop. We're also just three blocks away from the Red Line, and if you have a bike, there's the lakefront bike path.
access: You've got buses, trains, and taxis everywhere, so a car is really a liability here, but if you do have one, you can rent a spot nearby. They are also building a fitness center on the ground floor -- but I don't know the target completion date.
interaction: If we're in town, we love meeting guests and even showing them around. If we're not around, we'll at least try to give you all the guidance you need.
house_rules: Please kick off your shoes when you come in (the carpet is nice and fluffy). Also, we charge a 60 cleaning fee, but this doesn't even come close to the cost of a "deep clean", so after a few very expensive cleaning bills, we increased our deposit and will charge as follows, if necessary: Oven: 120 Refrigerator: 80 General cleaning above three hours: 20/per hour We're also happy to discuss this with you. Absolutely NO SMOKING and NO PETS. You can have a few guests over, but this is a family building and we have good relations with our neighbors, so please NO LOUD PARTIES. Building management is great, but we'd still prefer you come to us with any non-emergency issues. We don't want to become a nuisance. ;-)
host_about: We're an environmental journalist from Chicago and a human-rights lawyer from Nairobi, and we travel a lot for work and pleasure -- which means our homes are each empty for months at a time. That's where you come in. ;-)

name: Acropolis area designer apartment
summary: My place is close to the Acropolis. Restaurants & nightlife of Koukaki & Petralona on the doorstep. It's 10 minutes drive from seafront. Close to 2 metro stops. Perfect base for exploring Athens' historic center and modern lifestyle. A restored designer apartment with stunning views over Philopappou hill & out to sea. Partial Acropolis view from roof terrace. Large kitchen perfect for entertaining. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids).
space: A recently renovated apartment in one of the most sought-after areas of central Athens, a five-minute stroll from the Acropolis and the pedestrianized zone that links the city's main ancient highlights.  It comes with a roof terrace with sweeping sea views out beyond southern Athens and Piraeus, and mountains views east over Mt. Hymettus.  The south and east facing walls of the apartment are floor-to-ceiling windows offering uninterrupted views of the forested hill of Philopappou. This gives light, air and a sense of greenery to the whole apartment.  The main bathroom and kitchen have been comprehensively rebuilt to the highest standards. The two double bedrooms are spacious and comfortable with warm wood floors, ample storage and minimal decoration. Beautiful original details from the building's 1970s construction include aluminum-framed balcony doors and wooden sliding shutters. The floors are marble and parquet, while the interiors have been kept light with the use of mid-century oa

A recently renovated apartment in one of the most sought-after areas of central Athens, a five-minute stroll from the Acropolis and the pedestrianized zone that links the city's main ancient highlights.  It comes with a roof terrace with sweeping sea views out beyond southern Athens and Piraeus, and mountains views east over Mt. Hymettus.  The south and east facing walls of the apartment are floor-to-ceiling windows offering uninterrupted views of the forested hill of Philopappou. This gives light, air
neighborhood_overview: The apartment overlooks Philopappou, one of the green lungs of Athens and the sister hill of the Acropolis, of which it has unrivalled views. It also sits atop Koukaki, a relaxed but fashionable Athens neighborhood with a great mix of restaurants, bars, cafes, specialty shops, two of the capital's finest bakeries (Takis and Mama Psomi) and its best sandwich shop (Guarantee).  There's a lively farmers' market on Friday mornings that draws the crowds and shows off seasonal produce from near and far in Greece. The apartment is close enough to the ancient auditorium of Herod Atticus that in the summer the concerts staged there for the Athens festival can be heard from the rooftop. Three of the best open-air cinemas (one of the joys of summer-time Athens) are a brief stroll from the front door. A short walk away is also Petralona, one of the hipper centers of Athens nightlife that stretches from international restaurants, to traditional tavernas and dozens of late-night watering holes. The
transit: Nearby (within 7 minutes walking) there are two Metro stations, Acropolis and Fix. There's easy access to the tram constructed for the 2004 Olympics which is a nice way to reach the seafront (about a 10-15-minute journey). Well-served by bus routes.
access: Guests have access to all areas of the apartment, as well as the roof terrace above it, accessible by a marble staircase.
interaction: Guests will be met on arrival and given keys as well as detailed instructions and help with the basics of the flat and anything they might need.  I will be available throughout by phone and email and can provide any emergency assistance that might be required, either in person or through trusted friends nearby.
host_about:
Writer and journalist based in Greece. 
I've been living and working in Athens, London, Lisbon, Nairobi and Johannesburg but always returning to Greece.

summary: Set back from a central London street, inside this large, high ceilinged three bedroom house offers calm and quiet, yet is only seconds walk from the bustling restaurants, bars, shops and cinemas of the trendy ¨Beach¨ area of the Fulham Road.
space: Set back from a central London street, inside this large, high ceiling three bedroom house offers calm and quiet, yet is only seconds walk from the bustling restaurants, bars, shops and cinemas of the trendy ¨Beach¨ area of the Fulham Road. It is also just minutes walk away from the Kings Road and River Thames and the amenities and museums of South Kensington. This Victorian house has recently been extensively modernized, opening up walls to make the rooms large, bright and airy and decorated by an interior designer to offer modern furnishings and original artwork whilst retaining its original charm. Spread over the four floors are a modern kitchen with large dining area, a double living room with several sofas, flat screen TV, DVD etc, a large master bedroom with luxury ensuite bathroom, two further double bedrooms (one with twin beds) and a further bathroom. The house has its own, totally secluded, 50 foot garden at the rear as well as off street parking to the front.

neighborhood_overview: The house is within walking distance of London's famous museums (Victoria & Albert, Science Museum, Natural History) and is conveniently situated for transport facilities (the metro stations of Earls Court, South Kensington and Fulham Broadway are roughly equi-distant, buses right into the centre run every 10 minutes from outside the house (20mins to Piccadilly Circus or Victoria). The famous 'Easybus' brings you directly from Gatwick Airport in about one hour to Fulham Broadway. There are several 24 hour supermarkets within minutes walk from the house. 20 minutes walk (5 mins jog) to Battersea Park and Cheyne Walk along the River Thames. The house is within minutes walk of many bars, eclectic and multi national restaurants, cinemas, galleries, a church, a gym (Virgin), shops, bakeries etc etc.
transit: There are buses to the heart of London running from outside the house.  Various tube stations each about 10 to 15 minutes walk  away (West Brompton, Earls Court, South Kensington).

If you are disabled this might not be the place for you - its a typical London town house on four floors with a few stairs between each
host_about: Gang leader of an international family of five that spends time between Madrid, London, Nairobi and Cape Town (dont worry, if we are booking with you we will certainly let you know if the whole gang is with us, it rarely is these days sadly).   We all speak English, French and Spanish.  Given the frequent traveling the best way to reach me is always by email!  Our houses reflect our love of art and the world and are real family homes rather than properties bought to let out.  We hate and avoid faceless hotels and boring resorts, preferring adventures in off beat, multi cultural, local places where we can learn about where we stay and blend in.

neighborhood_overview: The location is excellent for those who want to be able to get into and out of the city but who don't need, or want, the more hectic urban scene of Lincoln Park, Wicker Park, Bucktown or Lakeview or other close in mixed use neighborhoods. This is almost a suburban feel: mostly Chicago bungalows with a few two to four flat buildings interspersed. Beautiful tree lined streets with lots of kids and people walking their pets.  Free street parking available. Many of our neighbors have lived here for over 30 years and now their children are moving back. You will see bungalows being remodeled with a second story addition, and tear-downs getting replaced with big houses. Within a few blocks there are an amazing and diverse number of churches, temples and mosques. Plenty of groceries, pharmacies, restaurants and entertainment half a mile or so away, an easy drive but a bit of a hike on foot; this is more of a residential neighborhood, not the kinetic pace of the urban/mixed use neighborhoods cl
notes: Base pricing is listed for the month and varies from 1800 to 2500 per month depending on the season. The calendar is up to date both on occupancy and rate, but if you need clarification please contact me. Street parking out front. Groceries are a short drive away, about half a mile.  Mayfair Park is only four blocks and there are churches and temples and mosques nearby. There is a great sports bar two blocks away and several pubs and a well known Karaoke place.  And three blocks away is a famous burger stand and soft serve joint (Susie's) that's open 24 hours!  Great Middle Eastern restaurant a few blocks away. And I order pizza all the time from Saparinos.  If you really want to experience the "foodie" part of Chicago, it's a short drive or L train to Logan Square, or Armitage & Western or to North Ave & Damen, where you can find several hundred restaurants and bars. Then come home to peace and quiet in my hood. If you smoke, there is a 500 cleaning fee. In general we don't accept
transit: Really easy actually. It's about a 10  minute walk, with luggage,  to the Blue Line which goes to the Loop in 25 min or outbound to O'Hare in about 20.  We can provide detailed instructions on how to get here from either airport using the L. You can park on the street if you are traveling by car. If you prefer to use taxis  from the airport you can do that in their taxi line. Once you are here, taxis and  Uber cars are available to pick you up within a few minutes. Most likely you will want to use the Blue Line to go into and out of the city, You can stop at any of the great urban neighborhoods on the way in (Irving Park, Logan Square,  Bucktown/Wicker Park at the North & Damen stop, for example). You can take the Blue Line straight in to Clark and Lake to transfer to Orange, Brown, Purple, Pink and Greeen lines, or on to the Jackson stop and walk three blocks over to Michigan Avenue and you will be at the Chicago Architecture Foundation about a block from the Art Institute. Buses and
access: You will have private access to the entire space —the pricing assumes 1  or 2 persons using one of the two bedrooms. If you have 2 to 4 people, using both bedrooms, the price increases 25 per person per night. And if you need to use the daybed in the office that is an additional 25. Please let me know your sleeping arrangements and I will send you a special offer that accounts for it.
interaction: You can always call or text me. I am available for anything related to the apartment or the community. Just reach out. This is a self contained flat and you will have full access to it for your stay. I live in the building and am available if you want to chat about things to do, places to see, or how to get around.  Or you can be entirely on your own. You will find a guide to our favorite things to do and places to go inside the "book" box on the  coffee table and part of it is included in the neighobrhood description below.
house_rules: We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014, including soundproofing between floors. But that doesn’t eliminate sound transfer, just moderates it. You will hear the tenants upstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices. Please moderate your sound so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm. We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 25. Nor are guests welcome who are not on the itinerary. NO parties.   No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a 500 cleaning fee. Pets may be allowed if we discuss it beforehand. In general we don't accept pets, but we will make an exception for a small, quiet (non yippy) short haired dog that can be crated. If you bring a pet, we require a 250 security deposit for the pet, in addition to the regular deposit. If anything isn’t working, please contact Jeffrey immediately. Text message
host_about:
I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I work for Apple. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first and second floors. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private) and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that's available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me). We also have a luxury 1 bedroom flat downtown in River North. Plus hope to be adding another River North location very soon. 
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek (obviously, as I work for Apple). I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. 
I am totally new to AirBnB and I have never been a guest — but I have friends and family who are guests (and hosts) and I just decided to do this instead of renting out the garden apartment this year. 
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on S.3rd & Bedford Avenue - which is the beginning of the popular Bedford Avenue Strip. It's in the quieter end of it so you will enjoy the benefits of this busy neighborhood in a quiet space.  You will be half a block away from great restaurants, bars, shops, food markets, etc.
notes: - We live on the 5TH FLOOR of a walk-up. (NO ELEVATOR) Please make sure you are aware of this before you book!!  - If I or my apartment manager is not home when you arrive, he/she will give you instructions to pick up the keys. - Our bathroom is small as shown in the photo, but is always perfectly clean! :) However, we do not have a cleaning person everyday, so I ask that guests be courteous of the other guests in the apartment and clean up after themselves. I always want the entire space to be comfortable for everyone and will always be sure to do everything I can to make that happen! I only ask that we all help each other stay happy and comfortable in a clean space!
transit: Transportation:  The apartment is 7 minutes away from the L train on the Bedford Avenue Stop, one stop to Manhattan and 5 minutes from Union Square. The L train will take you from the East side to the West side connecting you to all of the major subway lines in NYC.  It is also located 7 minutes away in the opposite direction from the J/M/Z lines. These lines will take to the center of the Lower East Side, Chinatown, City Hall, Wall Street, and Fulton Street which is a 7 minute walk from the South Street Seaport. The M train will take you directly into Midtown. Subway map: (URL HIDDEN)  L train is the gray line  J/M/Z trains are the brown line  PARKING: There is free street parking on my street and the streets around the building, but there are alternate side parking rules that you have to be aware of and follow to avoid getting parking tickets.
access: Guests have access to all the common areas (living room/kitchen, etc.) Everyone MUST be considerate of each other. Please clean up after yourselves in all common areas especially the bathroom!!  We cannot be available to clean the bathroom everyday, and depend on the guests to clean up after themselves.  AMENITIES:  - Washing machine and dryer in the apartment (this is a luxury one does not find in many NYC apartments! or hotels!)  - Full Kitchen  - Coffee and Tea - you can enjoy great meals all over the neighborhood or buy cool stuff at the local supermarkets to prepare at the apartment! :) - Free Wifi Web Access - Hair Dryer - Iron & Ironing Board  - Fresh Towels / Bed Linens  - Air Conditioner in this room only - 1 set of keys per 2 people (come and go as you please)
interaction: When I am not in the apartment myself, I spend my time in Nairobi, Kenya with my husband. In my absence, there is always an apartment manager in the 3rd bedroom to help with any questions you may have.  I am also always available via email and respond very quickly.
house_rules: 2 people max. PER BEDROOM - Must provide ID (Passport/License) for security purposes. No events or parties allowed. Packages CANNOT be ordered or delivered to my address.  Please, no pets (I'm allergic!)  No Smoking (I'm allergic to that, too!) No Drugs or Hard Alcohol however, we can all enjoy a nice wine! :o) Be respectful of neighbors and the space  Keep noise down after hours  Clean up after yourself

host_about: I am Augustin. My friends also call me "Gusty". As a "citizen of the world",  I am lucky to have grown and evolved through many cultures. I was born and raised in Yaoundé in the beautiful country of Cameroon.  At age 20, I moved to Colorado to attend the U.S Air Force Academy where I studied electrical engineering and trained and competed in collegiate boxing. I went on the graduate school and completed a master’s degree in electrical engineering with an emphasis in radar and electromagnetic wave propagation. I work as a consultant for fiber distributed antennas systems for better speed and data rates inside high-capacity building for technologies such as 4G LTE and Wi-Fi. I am also working on several other entrepreneurial ventures that I hope will spread all over the world soon. I love to travel for work or pleasure, meet new people, and experience new foods and cultures. I love to train in Brazilian jiu-jitsu and I bring my kimono everywhere I go.  I also love trail running, high altitude hiking, boxing, Thai boxing, wrestling, mma, and yoga. My favorite places to go include San Francisco, Denver, Yaoundé, Nairobi, and Malawi. I would love to visit Brazil to train BJJ and Iceland to hike an active volcano next. I am a huge James Bond fan. My favorites 007 movie are Octopussy and Die Another Day. I like to catch a Jazz or Reggae show when possible.  I love all kinds of food and I will eat anything, especially lots of spices, fish, vegetables and meats. When I travel I love to feel fully immerse into the local culture. That is why I don’t hotels anymore else absolutely necessary. When I host a guest, I treat them like an old friend who visiting from another town. I want to them be as comfortable as possible and fully enjoy their stay. I tell them about places to see and what restaurants to try. I am fluent in English, French and I am learning Portuguese and Spanish. My life motto is: “Treat all people with respect, live passionately!”

neighborhood_overview: This neighbourhood is low-density upmarket urban with quiet roads and very pleasant walks, such as along the banks of the Water of Leith.  Murrayfiled, a first-class golf course is situated very close to the property and allows guests. The Murrayfield rugby stadium and an ice rink are within walking distance. Nearby are a set of basic shops that include an excellent butcher and a convenience store.  A few minutes drive away is a mall with a large Sainsbury's supermarket, Marks & Spencer and a raft of other brand stores.  In another direction towards Corstorphine is a Tesco Extra and other big brand outlets. The location is ideal for whatever you wish to do and achieve in Edinburgh.
notes: The apartment is a quiet location with good privacy and either parking on site or on the adjacent street (no charge currently). Close by is the Murrayfield Rugby Ground and an Ice Rink. Murrayfield golf course is a splendid hillside course with fantastic views and it is just two minutes walking.  THis is a leafy area with large grand houses and some fabulous and relaxing walkways. For easy going the water of leith can be followed along its banks right through the city to Leith. Within ten minutes on can be into and through the woods of Corstorphine Hill  and there find the most awesome panoramic views across the firth of forth, the castle and arthurs seat and the stark Pentland Hills. The latter can be accessed in ten minutes by car. You are just 1.5 miles from Princes Strret and all its shops Close by is a traditional butcher, Within five minutes you can be at a mall with Sainsburys, Marks and Spencer, Boots and other stores, while  two miles away at Corstorphine there is another mall
transit: The apartment is set in a quiet, leafy part of Murrayfield, where you may feel private, secure and safe.  Nearby are bus stops that provide for carriage to most parts of Edinburgh, including Princes Street, Haymarket and Waverley stations and the International Airport. Frequent airport services stop within about 300 yards of the property.  If you want to use the bus it is advisable to visit a Lothian Buses shop at either Haymarket or Waverley station and purchase a "ridacard".  Available for set periods, the ridacard enables you to hop on and off buses as you please, including airport and night buses. Single journeys are £1.50, while day cards are £4 From a bus stop at Western Corner near the property there are buses every few minutes to Haymarket (5 minutes) and Princes Street (10 minutes). Bus numbers are 12, 26 and 31. Very close to the property bus 38 serves trendy stockbridge and goes on to the sea at West Granton. All services are frequent, though reduced services operate on Sund
access: Ideal for professionals coming to Edinburgh for business on short/long-term stays, or families with school-age children visiting the city. Couples also welcome.  The whole apartment is for your use and provides a home from home. For sunny days there is french window access to the lawns that surround the property.  For professionals the accomodation provides well for entertaining a key client. There is limited on-site parking but ample free parking on the quiet street close to the property. The flat has a patio on the lawns to one side and all guests may walk the lawns
interaction: Upon arrival you will be met and greeted. The host will help you explore and familiarise yourself with the apartment and the operation of its services. Once you are settled you will be provided with a telephone contact for use between 09.00 - 17.00 Monday through Friday, in case you need any help with anything. This number may also be used out of hours in emergency.
house_rules: Your well-equipped flat is your home for your stay. Please treat it as you would your own home and leave all as you found it. If you do have an accident and break a plate or some-such please replace the item. A few simple rules: no smoking; no drugs; and no parties, including hen and stag parties. The no-party rule does not apply to professional entertaining a client, having a couple round for dinner or similar actions.
host_about:
University educated and retired from a professional career I am happy to share our Edinburgh home with discerning professionals, singles, couples or families with school age children (or older). 

My career was principally in agricultural development and ranged from soil management to fair trade business development and contract farming. I am widely travelled and with freedom now I still travel. 

My hobbies include sailing (a Tayana cruiser based in Greece), scuba diving, underwater and terrestrial photography, mountain walking, skiing as well as urban pursuits of eating out, theatre and more. 

I have known Edinburgh for many years and can help you make the most of your time in this fabulous city. If I am not around when you visit my son ( a journalist and website specialist) or my friend Barbara will be there to help you.

space: This is my home, in a wonderful residential neighborhood. PLEASE NOTE: We are not walking distance to bars and restaurants (try Wicker Park, Bucktown, Lakeview if this is what you are looking for). neighborhood_overview: This is a traditional Chicago neighborhood of bungalows, two flats, and the occasional apartment building. Our four-flat is the tallest building on the block. Walkable from the L and bus lines, but also free street parking.  If you decide to stay here please don't later give a critique that we aren't in a trendy, hip area dotted with clubs and taverns. If that is what you are looking for you should try Bucktown, Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, or Lakeview.  Our neighborhood is lovely. It's quiet and safe. When guests aren't in town I rarely remember to lock my door. I know my neighbors and they invite me over to use their pool and I know their kids. We are a block from a major Catholic church and kids in the neighborhood either go there or to the excellent neighborhood elementary school, and they all play a few blocks from here at Mayfair Park. In many ways this is a throw back to the neighborhoods of the 1950's.  I know some great places to eat and drink but most of them are not within a c
notes: This is a list of the stuff that we simply must talk about: I am pet friendly but we gotta talk about your pet before you arrive. If your animal is not able to be quiet or is aggressive, it's just not gonna work. You know your pet, so let's just agree that if you have a VERY agreeable pet, you are welcome to bring it along. But if it's not, please don't even ask.
transit: We are about halfway between O'Hare and the Loop on the Blue Line. Street parking is free and plentiful, no parking permits needed (ever). We do have street cleaning from April to October, so you will see signs that are posted to NOT park on one side of the street the next day. They are RUTHLESS about this and you will get a ticket, but you won't get towed.  The Blue Line L train is 6 blocks away (the Montrose stop—walk two blocks south then turn right, west, four more blocks). We are 5 stops from O'hare and 14 stops from downtown. There is a Montrose bus on Montrose Ave (two blocks south) that goes all the way to the lake shore.  You can order a taxi or uber and it will be here within minutes.
access: You can access the entire space except for the back bedroom/office where I occasionally sleep and where I work every work day. It can't be super loud during those hours as I answer the phone for Apple during that time.
interaction: I am always available to talk to you over the phone and I will generally greet guests personally.  I will be coming over every day for a few hours to work but mostly you will find that I am not in your business. I will bring fresh pastry every morning though! I personally know several chefs at top restaurants and I will gladly help you get into cool places. I used to go to the bars a lot and I can recommend many great places for food, drink, breakfast, donuts, you name it.
house_rules: We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k cup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.   Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm. We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 25. And we need to know the names of all guests in the group so please add them to the booking. No guests who are not on the itinerary.  NO parties.   No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a 500 cleaning fee. If you do drugs? We will
host_about:
I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I work for Apple. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first and second floors. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private) and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that's available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me). We also have a luxury 1 bedroom flat downtown in River North. Plus hope to be adding another River North location very soon. 
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek (obviously, as I work for Apple). I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. 
I am totally new to AirBnB and I have never been a guest — but I have friends and family who are guests (and hosts) and I just decided to do this instead of renting out the garden apartment this year. 
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

Fun, happy, welcoming, hospitable and looking forward to meet and know new people. My wife and I travel a lot to Kenya say twice a year. We run a charity in Kenya supporting an orphanage of 185 kids. We are also setting up a mission tourism camp at Lolgorian just next to the Maasai Mara Game Reserve. We always welcome friends and volunteers to visit our home here in Melbourne as well as come along to visit our projects in Kenya, live in Nairobi with our family and friends, travel to the village (400Km from Nairobi), live in the village and share village life volunteering services in our village, do a safari viewing wild life in the Maasai Mara and interact with the amazing Maasai people and enjoy their culture. We are full of life and activity and you need to check us out and take us on. We look forward to see you soon!

neighborhood_overview: We have great, urban-village-like local amenities. There are excellent cafes, restaurants, and pubs in the nearby vicinity. A supermarket and independent greengrocers for food shopping and also hair salons, barbers and the long standing New Beacon Bookshop all located along Stroud Green Road. Crouch End, Primrose Hill, Regents Park, Hampstead Heath and Angel Islington with the Sunday Farmer's Market are all 20 minutes away by bus, half that by car. Please click on the Guidebook link below to get started.
notes: ~ Please get in touch with bookings shorter than 3 days. I'm happy to consider a long weekend.  ~ You airbnb profile photo and bio (even if just a short one) is appreciated. I cannot guarantee to confirm your booking otherwise.
transit: The flat is located 5-7 minutes from Finsbury Park tube and train station - 15 mins to Oxford Circus, 10 mins from Kings Cross St Pancras on the Victoria and Piccadilly lines; also the London Overground from Highbury. Excellent transport links for getting around London (personally, I love it)!
access: Cosy and spacious living room, hygienic bathroom, the kitchen for light cooking (inc. microwave), also use of the washer and dryer. Then of course the bedroom pictured, with the (memory foam mattress, i.e. very comfy) double bed. A good night's sleep is important after sightseeing in Piccadilly Circus or Trafalgar Square. There is also a TV in the room. Bonus!
interaction: The flat is occupied by the host and two friendly cats and the room is available immediately for a single female or male (no couples). Professional, student or traveller. Ideally, friendly, independent, tidy and respectful. If coming from abroad as a tourist there's lots to do in London and the local area for all budgets - Buckingham Palace to Brick Lane Market!
host_about:
Friendly, respectful and full of information about the local area and London. I'm a chilled out host who lets guests get on with their holiday or stay in peace, but always available for a chat or a local pick up from station or info on getting around town or the area. Two cats live here too. Nice cats. 

Five things I cannot live without are my MacBook Pro, my iPhone, poetry books and novels, fresh fruit and veg for juicing. I like the sights and sounds of London, particularly South Bank, theatre and spoken word poetry nights, the cinema and the parks. I love Kenya, Nairobi, Mombasa and the Masai Mara. I like Spain such as Barcelona, Madrid, Granada, the mountains of Andalusia and the Alpujarras. Ibiza's fun, even without the clubbing as the beaches are brilliant. I also like St Lucia, Guyana and New Zealand. Would love to travel to Costa Rica, Cuba, Mexico, New York, LA, maybe Miami, Tanzania, Thailand.

summary: Newly renovated, spacious and quaint loft apartment with ultra-comfortable queen bed, large daybed couch, walk-in closet, bathroom, laundry area (inclusive of washer and dryer) and private backyard. Showcases an absolutely unique collection of contemporary art and a state-of-the-art stereo system.  In the heart of Bed-Stuy, cradle of jazz and hip-hop and close to all other areas of Brooklyn.
space: Welcome to the Artists Den! As soon as you walk into the large open plan, you will be seduced by the inviting vibe of this newly renovated loft apartment, with its rustic exposed brick wall, and the hardwood floor cozily framing the space. The living unit (bedroom, lounge/dining area, kitchen) boasts a high beam ceiling, allowing for a bright and airy atmosphere. Simply fold the brownstone-style interior shutters, and the room gushes with natural light, pouring through the bay window in the front façade. Or would you rather nestle into a homelike cocoon? Just draw the curtains to create a friendly intimacy, and the gentle glow of ceiling spotlights will bring life to a piquant collection of paintings, photographs, sculptures and other works by celebrated contemporary artists, fused with an exquisite assemblage of African artifacts and furniture.  Settle snugly in the sectional sofa, or rest your head against the tall headboard of the platform, queen size, bed: two perfect spots to kick

neighborhood_overview: Ready for a night on the town? You will find yourself in the heart of the historical neighborhood of Bedford-Stuyvesant, one of the most vibrant and diverse neighborhoods in the world, cradle of jazz and birthplace of many icons of American literature, sports, entertainment and politics.
transit: 10 minutes walk, 4 minutes Uber to a large variety of bars and restaurants that have existed in the neighborhood for 6 months or 80 years. A quick bus ride or 10 minutes Uber from both Fort Greene and Williamsburg, if that's the vibe you want to explore. Prefer Manhattan? There are 2 subway stops 10 minutes walk away. From there, it's a 35-40 minutes ride to downtown Manhattan. If walking is not for you...there are several bus lines one block away that take to downtown Brooklyn, where all the subway lines to Manhattan stop. And of course Uber is also an option if you can spend a bit more money.
interaction: Clear information will be available in the house, and the amazing hosts Astrid and Daapo are going to be available to help you at all time.
house_rules: Please leave your shoes in the hallway. The wooden floors are delicate.

neighborhood_overview: Skt Hans Torv is the #1 place for experiencing the charming, hip and modern life of Copenhagen. With access to a broad range of cafés, bars and small restaurants there is no excuse for not going out for either brunch, a nice lunch in the sun, a cozy dinner or innovative cocktails or a glass of wine at night.  Moreover, the apartment is located just 400 meters from both the big park, Fælledparken, and the five lakes of Copenhagen - both places ideal for a morning run (a favorite activity for local Copenhageners).

host_about:
hello AirBnB community:   delighted to be part of your NYC experience.  
a little about me:  i am a feminist, queer academic/activist/professor who teaches gender, sexuality and economics.  i've had the privilege to live in karachi, nairobi, london, singapore, atlanta and washington, dc and now call NYC home.    i find my neighborhood to be very soulful with a rich and complex history of the development and gentrification of brooklyn.  it serves as both a quiet space for both celebration and reflection.   i cherish what my neighborhood and my home has to offer ranging from runs in prospect park, coffee at the various cafes on washington, a stiff cocktail at various neighborhood bars and delicious food from around our globe.  also enjoy my time at home, cooking and hosting dinner parties, reading and writing in the garden, or a low key evening sipping on vermouth, wine or whiskey in the coziness of my living room.  look forward to hosting my fellow residents.  please email me with any questions and tell me a little something about you.

neighborhood_overview: I love this neighbourhood! Haymarket Terrace is within easy walking distance of central Edinburgh. Situated just off Princes Street there are restaurants, bars, cafes, plus all the attractions of the Festival close by. The Water of Leith can be easily accessed via a stairway nearby - the walkway along the river links the Gallery of Modern Art with Stockbridge and Edinburgh's wonderful Botanical Gardens.
notes: Linen and towels are provided; also reading lights.   During the Edinburgh Festival and Christmas and New Year, the price per night is slightly higher, with the usual discount per 7 nights booked.
transit: Haymarket Terrace is one of the main routes to and from the airport with a tram stop just outside the building. Buses can also be caught to most locations from here and taxis are freely available on the street. Trains to Glasgow and elsewhere can be caught from Haymarket Station just 2 minutes walk from the flat.
access: The kitchen is fully fitted with a cooker, fridge/freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, microwave.
interaction: If I am not around to welcome you I will make sure that someone is there to show you the ropes when you arrive.
house_rules: Please do not smoke, and no pets!  I would also appreciate it if you could leave the place as you find it. This is my home so treat it as you would your own, with care. Thank you.
host_about:
Having lived and worked in conflict zones across Africa and within Europe (Kosovo) I greatly value my current location on the edge of Nairobi National Park. It is peaceful and yet within minutes I can join the hustle and bustle of the city, and meet up with friends in one of the many coffee houses. This area is perfect for contemplation. Wildlife including a huge selection of birds abounds. I feel so privileged to have found this spot and enjoy sharing its natural beauty with visitors. 
I was born in Edinburgh, Scotland and have a flat there which is also available for lets. Golden light on sandstone, views to the sea, the world's first 'skyscrapers' ie tenement flats, not to mention the fascinating range of historic buildings and landscape, all in one city! The Athens of the North still surprises me on my frequent return visits. And we are in interesting times politically. Scotland may not be independent but the debate leading up to the referendum in September 2014 has had a lasting legacy : greater public participation in defining and realising a United Kingdom that all its citizens can be proud of.
street: Haymarket Terrace, Edinburgh, EH12 5JZ, United Kingdom

host_about: My wife, Lynn, and I are long-time human rights advocates from Washington DC. We met in 1997 when we were both working to support self-determination for East Timor. Within a year, I moved in with Lynn in Washington DC and we adopted Wonji, our loyal Aussie. After East Timor became independent, Lynn went on to work with Amnesty International, and then pursue a PhD in political science with a focus on the Horn of Africa. Lynn spent a year in Nairobi working with the UN on Somalia, and she is now Director of Global Programs at Freedom House (an NGO cofounded by Eleanor Roosevelt). I moved from a singular focus on East Timor to a singular focus on Iraq, founding the Education for Peace in Iraq Center (EPIC) in 1998. EPIC works to promote peace in Iraq through US-based advocacy, research, and field work. A couple years ago, Lynn and I adopted our son, Caleb, from Ethiopia, and he has been a source of joy in our lives ever since. We both love being near the ocean, reading fiction especially mystery novels, good movies, Mad Men, Star Trek, biking, hiking, kayaking, vegetarian cooking, dining out, and travel. More recently, we've rediscovered the joys of sandboxes, trains, blocks, kites, and blowing bubbles. I also really love good coffee and beer, and enjoy sharing new discoveries.

Beautiful tree lined streets with lots of kids and people walking their pets.  Many of our neighbors have lived here for over 30 years and now their children are moving back. You will see bungalows being remodeled with a second story addition, and tear-downs getting replaced with big houses. Within a few blocks there are an amazing and diverse number of churches, temples and mosques. Plenty of groceries, pharmacies, restaurants and entertainment half a mile or so away, but this is more of a residential neighborhood, not the kinetic pace of the urban/mixed use neighborhoods closer in. Four blocks from Mayfair Park.  Nearby are Independence Park (accessible on the Blue Line at Irving Park) and Portage Park (2 miles west and south from here and also on Irving Park Boulevard),  both of which run great farmer's markets on several Sundays through October. It's about a 10  minute walk, with luggage,  to the Blue Line which goes to the Loop in 25 min or outbound to O'Hare in about 20.  The Montrose bus is two blocks away and a 25 min ride to the beachfront at Lake Michigan or to the Brown Line.  The Lawrence Ave bus is a few blocks north and travels east about a mile to the Brown Line (or all the way to the lakefront, too). Brown Line goes to the Loop and stops a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue as well, with stops along the way at DePaul or Lincoln Park or Old Town. You can transfer to the Red Line from the Brown Line at Belmont or Fullerton and go to the Apple Store Lincoln Park or keep going  and get off at Grand to walk over to North Michigan Avenue or on to State Street and all that provides. If you are traveling by car, your GPS will find us easily.
access: Premium on-demand cable tv, Amazon Prime & Netflix Fully appointed kitchen with dish washer & washer/dryer Super fast Wi-Fi Guests have full access to the kitchen and living areas. This listing is for the front Bunkbed bedroom.  However, the apartment is fully furnished for a large family, with a twin daybed in one room, queen bed in another for when my kids come to stay. If you want the whole place we can make it available in between their visits. interaction: Not often in person but constantly vie text & mobile You can call or text me pretty much any time if you have any questions or need anything at all.  I work from home, and I live in the unit.  You will have access to the living and dining area, and both full and half bathrooms, along with the kitchen, but not to the fourth bedroom/office at the very back of the building, where I will work on weekdays, and where I may sleep. I'm often gone in evenings overnight. I won't get in your way, and am rarely around when guests stay, but close by if you need me.  I am happy to act as a host and provide tips on where to go and what to see, or to just leave you on your own.
house_rules: We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k cup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.   Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm. host_about:
I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I work for Apple. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first and second floors. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private) and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that's available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me). We also have a luxury 1 bedroom flat downtown in River North. Plus hope to be adding another River North location very soon. 
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek (obviously, as I work for Apple). I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. 
I am totally new to AirBnB and I have never been a guest — but I have friends and family who are guests (and hosts) and I just decided to do this instead of renting out the garden apartment this year. 
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

name: Join us in Lakeview!
summary: Are you a student or businessperson in town for a month or more? Then join us on the lake. We have a panoramic view of the city -- from the Loop to Wrigley Field -- that's bright by day and majestic by night, when the city lights glitter below.
space: We've got a very roomy high-rise apartment with plenty of natural light and two giant Love Sacs instead of sofas. The building itself is a generic high-rise just off the lake, so it's nothing special, but the neighborhood is incredible and the view is divine. All but one of our reviews have been five-star across-the-board, and we're sure you'll like staying with us. You'll have a queen bed with a firm, new mattress and a view of the Loop, and you'll share access to the common areas -- the dining area, the bathroom, and the kitchen -- with us, and we encourage you to take full advantage. Please note this is the exact SAME UNIT we listed as "Glorious Lakeview Apartment", but we created this separate listing because AirBnB won't let us categorize the same unit a private room on some days and a full home on others, so to avoid confusion we broke this off as a separate listing. If you read our reviews, you'll see we're quite easy to live with. There's a laundry room on the ground floor, and

neighborhood_overview: We're at the edge of Lakeview, right where it gives way to Boys Town (the LGBT neighborhood). That's one block away from Belmont Harbor, five blocks away from Wrigley Field, and a stone's throw away from tons of amazing restaurants and bars. (For the sake of privacy, we placed the pin a couple blocks away from our true location -- we can send the exact address upon inquiry.)
notes: Keep in mind that the pin is actually located a bit closer to the lake than where we dropped it -- we'll send the exact address upon inquiry.
transit: If you want to head downtown, you can easily walk or bike along the lake, and if you're in a hurry you can take one of three buses that stop across the street and take you right to the Loop. We're also just three blocks away from the Red Line, and if you have a bike, there's the lakefront bike path
access: There's a laundry room on the ground floor, and we can provide you with a rechargeable payment card for that. A few people have shown up with cars, and that's really a liability in this neighborhood. You've got buses, trains, and taxis everywhere, and parking is expensive. (The building has an attached garage, and we initially rented a parking spot for our guests, but only one person used it over a six-month period, so we cut our losses on that.)
interaction: We love the social aspect but don't force ourselves on our house-mates.
house_rules: We ask that you kick off your shoes when you come in -- especially if it's raining or snowing, because the carpet is light-colored and does get mangy.  Also, don't put used linens back on the shelf when you're done -- otherwise, they may not get washed. Beyond that, our rules are really just the rules of reason: no smoking, no loud parties, no kicking the neighbors' dogs...
host_about: We're an environmental journalist from Chicago and a human-rights lawyer from Nairobi, and we travel a lot for work and pleasure -- which means our homes are each empty for months at a time. That's where you come in. ;-)

name: Afro-soul lounge - 2 Bedroom apartment
summary: Newly renovated, spacious 2 bedroom apartment with exquisite living room and private bathroom. Master bedroom features a California king size bed and a built-in closet. Smaller bedroom has an ultra-comfortable full size bed. Living room features custom-made furniture by a celebrated Afro-soul designer, as well as a vibrant and unique collection of contemporary art. In the heart of Bed-Stuy, cradle of jazz and hip-hop and close to all other areas of Brooklyn.
space: Inviting guests on a voyage within its walls, the Afro-Soul arts lounge is a zingy statement of cosmopolitanism nestled on the second floor of a nineteenth-century Brooklyn brownstone.  In the spirit of all things Brooklyn, this metropolitan hideaway tastefully amalgamates Victorian interior, custom-built furniture by one of the celebrated kings of Afro-soul design, and a unique and piquant collection of contemporary artworks into an energetic, sophisticated, and welcoming environment.  Self-contained and intended for guests’ exclusive use, the apartment is comprised of two bedrooms, a sitting/dining room, a bathroom, and a fully equipped kitchen.  The spacious master bedroom blends coziness with aesthetic appeal: a king size bed with color-popping pillows exquisitely complemented by a sumptuous carved wooden footrest, a new and contemporary  wardrobe storage. Overlooking the ground-floor patio’s quiet atmosphere, the room opens into an ivory bathroom with a 6ft long vintage claw foot
