neighborhood_overview: Ready for a night on the town? You will find yourself in the heart of the historical neighborhood of Bedford-Stuyvesant, one of the most vibrant and diverse neighborhoods in the world, cradle of jazz and birthplace of many icons of American literature, sports, entertainment and politics.
transit: 10 minutes walk, 4 minutes Uber to a large variety of bars and restaurants that have existed in the neighborhood for 6 months or 80 years. A quick bus ride or 10 minutes Uber from both Fort Greene and Williamsburg, if that's the vibe you want to explore. Prefer Manhattan?  There are 2 subway stops 10 minutes walk away. From there, it's a 35-40 minutes ride to downtown Manhattan. If walking is not for you...there are several bus lines one block away that take to downtown Brooklyn, where all the subway lines to Manhattan stop. And of course Uber is also an option if you can spend a bit more money.
interaction: Clear information will be available in the house, and the amazing hosts Astrid and Daapo are going to be available to help you at all time.
house_rules: - Please leave your shoes in the hallway. The wooden floors are delicate.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: (A little bit...) over 40; originally from Napoli (Italy); lived in 4 continents, now hopping between New York and Nairobi. Engineer and Master in Business Administration, executive in a beauty company; love my family, contemporary art, Brazilian jiu-jitsu, my matte black BMW motorbike, and all the people in the world that have an open mind and love to learn about others.

neighborhood_overview: The area is beautiful because it combines the urban aspect of Toronto with its natural side. While there are nice shopping areas around (Bloor West Village a bit north, and Roncesvalles area a bit east), there are also stunning natural gems such as High Park and the Humber Bridge area. This neighbourhood is right by the lake which is absolutely gorgeous on a nice summer day. It's also a quiet area - not rowdy at all and the air is nice thanks to the lake and all of the trees in the area.
notes: There is no TV in the unit. However, you wont need a TV because of all the fun things to do around! Building is wheelchair accessible
transit: Parking is available at the unit. It takes roughly 20 minutes to bike downtown and around 30 to get there via transit. Easiest routes are to take the 77 Swansea from Runnymede station, or the 80 from Keele station. Building is located in front of a 24 hour queen street car stop!
access: You'll be able to access the pool areas, the gyms, the sauna, parking garage, the balcony and all parts of the unit.
house_rules: - Smoking is only permitted on the balcony  - We ask that you respect the neighbours by not being excessively loud after 11pm - Check in after 3pm unless otherwise agreed upon!
host_about:
Hey folks my name is Kevin and I'm a flight attendant! I'm basically away for a large chunk of the month which is why I've decided to rent out my space on Airbnb! Besides that I'm 25 and studied criminology in university. I finished school in 2015 and decided that I wanted to take some time off (2 years to be precise) to travel, see the world and challenge myself. I've taken mini trips to Israel, Argentina, Belgium, Mexico and Costa Rica so I'd love to chat with you folks about travel experiences. 

I like to dance a lot, spend my time traveling the world, interested in anything to do with the Canadian criminal justice system + its intersections with race, gender and sexuality, speak french and spanish, and when I'm home I spend most of my time watching anime or rollerblading around the city! 

Looking forward to connecting!

- Kev
________

Hey, my name is Amy! Kevin and I went to the University of Toronto where we became great friends in our undergrad. I will be co-hosting his awesome space on Airbnb. Please feel free to message either Kevin or I and we will get back to you shortly. A little bit about me. I am born and raised in Toronto, t.dot, "the six". I am a 25 year old mental health advocate. I work with communities in and around the GTA ( Greater Toronto Area). I currently work at a Market Research firm conducting research.

Most recently, I traveled to Abu Dahbi , New York and Nairobi. I plan to backpack in Europe in due time. I hope to meet great people on Airbnb who can share their love of traveling with me! Keep in mind Toronto in the summer is the PLACE to be! 
I can provide travellers with tips and locations to spend their stay at Kevins place. Any tourist attractions you want to see? I probably have been there and can give you great advice about where to go depending on your interests.

Hope to see you in Toronto soon!

Cheers

Amy

host_about:
Hello.  My name is Emmanuel, but most of my friends call me Manny.  I am a Kenyan-Canadian artist and entrepreneur.  I am outgoing and love to host, mostly because it has given me the chance to interact with many great people of diverse backgrounds and cultures from around the world. I have previously hosted college students from the US and Canada. 

I love Africa and often encourage people to visit.  I will make every effort to ensure that you have a pleasant stay here.  I welcome all with love and respect.  I will be happy to point you to various attractions and hotspots around the city or to even show you around myself whenever I am available.  

The apartment building is located very close to the Junction Mall on Ngong Road where you'll find several chic bars and restaurants.  As well, there is a cinema, supermarket and a variety of other stores at the Junction Mall and it's environs.  

The private room you will be staying in is in a two bedroomed apartment.  My girlfriend and I live in one room while you will be staying in the other room.  We are very respectful of guests and will give you all the space you need.  Your room is self-contained with it's own toilet and shower.  There is wireless internet available throughout the apartment. There is also a balcony where you can sit and take in some of the sights and sounds of Nairobi.  If you so wish, I can also provide you with a local mobile phone line to use during your stay.  Breakfast will be provided for you at no extra charge.  Additional meals can be arranged for a fee.  

Public transport is available right outside the entrance to the apartment building.  However, if you so wish, I can organize alternative transportation for you at reasonable rates.  This includes:
- airport pick-up and drop-off
- daily transport.  A fuelled vehicle and chauffeur can be provided for you at a reasonable daily rate

Thank you and hope to see you soon.

neighborhood_overview: Hounslow (/ˈhaʊnzloʊ/) is the principal town in the London Borough of Hounslow in Greater London and is part of the historic county of Middlesex.  You might want to visit Hounslow Heath -a large public open space and local nature reserve to the west of Hounslow, a London borough. It now covers about 200 acres (80 ha), the residue of the historic Hounslow Heath that covered over 4,000 acres (1,600 ha). The Heath has major historical importance: routes from London to the west and southwest of Britain used to pass through it. Staines Road, the northern boundary of the present Heath, was the Roman Road, Trinobantes. There are several historic references to Roman camps on or close to the Heath. Continuous recorded history dates back to Norman times. It gave its name to the former hamlet of Heathrow. Hounslow has a very high immigration rate. According to the 2011 Census, more than 50% of Hounslow residents are born outside of the UK. Singer/Songwriter Phil Collins was born and raised in Hou
transit: You will have free parking in our driveway. If you are travelling by public transport: London Underground Hounslow West (0.8 miles) London Underground Hounslow Central (1.4 miles) National Train Station Southall (1.5 miles)

We’ll ensure your space is likewise respected in return. Due to previous problems (and we’re sure this doesn’t relate to you…) we’ve needed to implement a minimum age requirement of 21+. Guests under the age of 21 are still entirely welcome – they will just need to be accompanied by parents or guardians. The easiest way to disrupt an enjoyable stay is a plumbing problem. To prevent this, we kindly ask you to please place things like sanity napkins in the sanitary bin we’ve provided in the bathroom. We simply want to ensure you have a royal flush kind of holiday :). If you’re coming to London to party you’ve picked a great city to do so. Unfortunately, just not at our place.

Hi,
My name is Gita Sehgal. I live in this house with my lovely husband of over 50 years -Vijay. I have 3 adult children and a 6month old grandson! So we have some spare bedrooms in the house as we are now empty nesters. 

I'm a Punjabi Indian, who was born in Nairobi, lived in India for 7 years and moved to London in the 70s. We love London and now that I'm retired I can enjoy the city more and relax. 

My favourite cuisine is Chinese, but we cook lots of yummy punjabi style curries at home. I love Bollywood movies and my favourite is a 70s classic called Sholay.

I love a good cup of tea and a biscuit and we look forward to hosting you in our home.
